This prevents duplicate reads or ignoring old data. To get the most recent data, call this method and just look at the latest result in the list, using the result’s metadata. The docs aren’t clear on this, but it’s highly likely that these results are in order, so it’s probably either the first or last element in the list. I’d run a quick test to see, and then from there just grab the latest “new” result each time.\u003cbr\u003e\nIf you wanted to simulate the feature of a call to \u003ccode\u003egetLatestResult()\u003c/code\u003e, you would have to keep track of what the most  recent value was and not change it if \u003ccode\u003egetAllUnreadResults()\u003c/code\u003e returns an empty list.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2025-05-23T14:37:10.545Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":43.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":502291,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-getallunreadtargets","display_username":"Nolan Barker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"Regular","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65568,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming Lead -
